fishes.name: Headlight Shrimp
fishes.description: Recognizable by their incredibly bright eyes, these shrimp lurk in deep waters and can spot food from hundreds of feet away. Their main form of defense is blinding their predators.

fishes.name: Double Puffer
fishes.description: These docile fish get their name from their second set of eyes. These help them scan their environment for survival, but their curiosity often gets the best of them.

fishes.name: Fangler
fishes.description: Carnivorous in nature, this species of angler uses its set of fangs to pierce any food it can find in its harsh environment.

fishes.name: Ghost Anchovy
fishes.description: These creatures often travel in large schools, but by using their phantom-like bodies to camouflage themselves, they can vanish almost instantly.

fishes.name: Glowstick Crawfish
fishes.description: Using their bioluminescent tails, these crustaceans can communicate with each other through flashing light patterns. Different groups use different light patterns and colors.

fishes.name: Venom Jelly
fishes.description: Feared by most small species, these jellyfish leave violet trails of intoxicating venom to catch their prey. They are most sought after for their vibrant hues and lethal properties.

fishes.name: Saber Swordfish
fishes.description: With incredible speed, these fish appear as streaks of bright light in their home waters. If you’re lucky enough to spot a school of them, their light shows are a sight to see.

fishes.name: Coldfish
fishes.description: Migrating from frigid northern waters, the Coldfish’s exterior is composed of hundreds of ice crystals. They are often caught and used as an infinite source of frost.

fishes.name: Cowboy Seahorse
fishes.description: First discovered in western seas, these creatures love a good rodeo. You’ll often find them in groups, dancing and leading carefree lives.

fishes.name: Wild Tempura
fishes.description: No need for a fryer, these guys are pre-cooked. As fried seafood grew in popularity, the balance of this shrimp’s natural seas shifted in favor of consumers.

fishes.name: Swole Crab
fishes.description: Known as one of the fiercest competitors of the sea, these crabs have incredible muscle definition and strength. No prey or predator stands a chance.

fishes.name: Soda Squid
fishes.description: Using carbonation as its energy source, the Soda Squid drifts slowly through the sea, leaving sweet, citrusy flavors in its trail.

fishes.name: Lobstache
fishes.description: Hello everybody! This species of lobster is known for its luscious pink mustache, stunning voice, and immaculate taste in video games.

fishes.name: Boot Carp
fishes.description: His boots are made for walking, and that’s just what he’ll do.

fishes.name: fish.png

fishes.name: Terrarium Catfish
fishes.description: Unlike any other fish species, these creatures use photosynthesis as their sustaining life force. Dwelling just under the surface, these fish love soaking up the sun.

fishes.name: Boba Fish
fishes.description: According to legend, these fish had consumed so much discarded boba they were punished by the Overlord, cursed to forever roam the seas in this pitiful form.

fishes.name: Cyber Salmon
fishes.description: A cybernetically evolved subspecies of Earth salmon. They sense both prey and predators using their intricate bionic eyes, and defend themselves with electric pulses.

fishes.name: Reel Eel
fishes.description: In a shimmering display, these creatures exhibit scenes from an age before recorded history. Their elusiveness makes them difficult to catch, keeping the memories they hold known to few.

fishes.name: Angelfish
fishes.description: Summoned to this planet by ethereal forces, the Angelfish blesses the seas with its divine presence. They are known to restore balance in the seas they travel, reversing human destruction.

fishes.name: Molten Arowana
fishes.description: Found in the deepest trenches of the sea, these incandescent creatures spawn from pure magma, cooling into the shape of an Arowana. They are known to produce fierce amounts of heat, constantly boiling the water that surrounds them.

fishes.name: The Overlord
fishes.description: Only seen by sharp eyes, this ancient creature has been written into local folklore for thousands of years. With a ferocious reign over all the planet’s seas, no enemy has left its grasp unscathed… until now.
